clinical_study.brief_title: Patient Satisfaction and Postoperative Analgesia Between Subarachnoid Block With 2-chloroprocaine Versus General Anesthesia for Knee Arthroscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial Evaluating Patient Satisfaction and Postoperative Analgesia Between Subarachnoid Block With 2-chloroprocaine Versus General Anesthesia for Knee Arthroscopy

brief_summary.textblock: The study evaluates the efficacy of two different anesthetic techniques in patients undergoing unilateral knee arthroscopy. Participants will be randomized to receive either subarachnoid block with 2-chloroprocaine or general anesthesia plus intravenous fentanyl.

detailed_description.textblock: The study evaluates the efficacy of two different anesthetic techniques in patients undergoing unilateral knee arthroscopy. Participants will be randomized to receive either subarachnoid block with 2-chloroprocaine or general anesthesia plus intravenous fentanyl. The study evaluates pain scores, opioid utilization and patient satisfaction.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Discharge from post anesthesia care unit (PACU) (usually one hour)
primary_outcome.description: Pain score measured with a patient reported 11 point Numeric Rating Pain Scale with 0 indicating no pain and 10 indicating worst pain imaginable.
Pain score measured with a patient reported 11 point Numeric Rating Pain Scale with 0 indicating no pain and 10 indicating worst pain imaginable.
Pain score measured with a patient reported 11 point Numeric Rating Pain Scale with 0 indicating no pain and 10 indicating worst pain imaginable.
Pain score measured with a patient reported 11 point Numeric Rating Pain Scale with 0 indicating no pain and 10 indicating worst pain imaginable.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Surgical completion to PACU discharge (usually one hour)
primary_outcome.description: Opioid utilization based on amount of opioid medications administered
Opioid utilization based on number of pain pills taken
Opioid utilization based on average number of pain pills taken per day
Opioid utilization based on average number of pain pills taken per day

secondary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction with anesthetic based on 10-item patient satisfaction survey validated for regional and general anesthesia

intervention.description: General anesthesia will be delivered per standard procedure. General anesthesia will include induction with propofol 1-3mg/kg followed by placement of a laryngeal mask airway with maintenance anesthesia of sevoflurane 0.5-1 minimum alveolar concentration (MAC).

Neuraxial anesthesia will be performed at the L2-3 or L3-4 interspace with a 25-gauge Whitacre needle in the sitting position. After free flow of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), 40-45mg of 2-chloroprocaine will be injected based on patient's height and discretion of attending anesthesiologist, needle withdrawn and the patient placed supine.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with ASA physical status classification of I, II, or III
- Patients without a current diagnosis of chronic pain or chronic opioid use for > 1-month prior to knee arthroscopy
- Patients who are scheduled to undergo unilateral knee arthroscopy
- Patients do not have a contraindication to receiving regional anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Preexisting sensory or motor deficit in operative extremity
- Patients with a contraindication to general anesthesia
- Patient undergoing meniscal or ligamentous repair
